text: Quand je pense à une Hefe, cest à une Hefe de ce genre que je pense. Le liquide nest pas trop pâle et affiche une tenue franche ainsi quun corps droit. Belle mousse collante au verre et fines bulles en suspension. Très jolie! Au nez par contre, le bonbon à la banane est trop puissant pour pleinement plaire à mes narines. Un fond céréalier sert dassise solide mais la banane est tout simplement un rien trop puissante. Levures européennes gardant lensemble équilibré malgré ce goût presque sûr de banane. Délicate amertume en fin de bouche alimentée par des bulles légères et frivoles. Très bonne weizen.

Une blonde trouble qui sent et goûte la banane, en différents dérivés. Une acidité propre au blé, une texture croquante et corpulente où simmiscent du poivre et dautre épices variées. Ça se boit tout seul. Cest agréable, cest bien fait et sans reproches. (1363-170115)

[6698-20140823] Tap. Boozy corn grain aroma. Hazy, pale orange body with a quick foamy white head. Boozy corn and toasted grains flavour. Medium body. Fair. (5/3/5/3/12) 2.8
(Tap Takeover Event @ Volo, Toronto, ON)
Hits the style but tad too much sweetness and banana. Banana yellow colour without a head. Also somewhat thin for style.

on tap at brewpub. hazy, almost cloudy pale yellow with a nice white head, some retention and lacing. plenty of bananas, spices - yes, cloves, wheat, touch of acidity, fresh grass, herbs. average carbonation, some fizz, light body, nice unbland herbal-citrusy finish.

On tap at Dieu du Ciel.
Pours hazy blond with good white head and nice lacing. Aroma is of bananas, yeast. Taste is of bananas, yeast, wheat. Overall: Very good, tasty.

Had this on tap at National for DDC! tap takeover. Pours a hazy bright yellow with a thick sticky foamy white head. The nose is pure hefe with big clove spices, wheaty and caramel malts, light banana fruitnotes too. The flavour is a bit sweet and bready with cloves and a bit of coriander coming through. Bananas, apples, no bubblegum though. Beautiful light citrus yeast esters and a crisp German yeast flavour. Overall, a fantastic Hefe up there with a great German Hefeweizen.

This is a brass opalescent blond coloured beer. It is topped by a thick compact foam which sticks to the glass and is sustained by a strong effervescence. Its fragrance is one of cloves with a hint of bananas, all of which is wrapped in an aroma of warm baked bread. Its a light tasting and fruity beer with only a mild flavour of hops. It is a very smooth tasting beer with a touch of acidity.

Un verre sur la rue Laurier.  Une robe plutôt blonde et finement voilée.  Une petite dentelle.  Un nez de blé, de fruits et dépices avec une présence herbacée.  Des saveurs qui se collent au genre avec une présence houblonnée indéniable.  Une bouche légère et sans tracas.  Une finale dépices qui se frottent à une amertume de houblons.

Un verre sur place. Robe classique blonde trouble avec une mousse blanche durable. Le nez est tout aussi dans le mille avec ses notes de crème de blé, banane, et épices. Rien naccroche. En bouche le liquide est tout aussi classique, avec du clou de girofle, des bananes et autres épices. La texture est parfaite et il y a une touche dacidité provenant du blé. 6+/10
#1104 draught; nose is hay, banana, citrus, cardamom, yeast, feel is watery, carb is mediumlow, taste is bittersweet lemon, sweet green apple, later medium bittersweet hops bite.

On tap at trou du diable. Light golden color, very slight haze, far from the traditional "white" appearance that I am used to for a hefeweizen. Aroma of crisp wheat, fresh bread notes, some yeastiness (light banana) with distinct new world hops. Flavor is light, kind of sweet, a touch of yeast and hops add spice to it all. Palate is light and fluffy. Very nice "north-americanization" of a classic style.

On tap at Dieu du Ciel.  Pours a hazed wheaty gold with a thin white head.  Sweet wheat, toast, light banana.  Gently sweet, more light banana flavors, yeasty.  Cool and clean.  Spicy yeast on the gums and lingering banana notes.

En fût. Verre de 12 oz dégusté directement à la brasserie. Arôme: Odeur dépices et de bananes avec une pointe de céréales. Apparence: La couleur est blonde voilée. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de coriandre et de zestes dornages avec une pointe de bananes. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence dépices en arrière goût. (Rating #2918)
Sampled on BQ2010. Pour a hazy gold body with nice white head. Aroma of wheat and coriander. Flavor consists of spice, clove, banana and wheat. Very well balanced.
Tried this beer while on Beer Quest 2010 with the guys. This was beer number 46. Pour a hazy gold. White head. Aroma of wheat and coriander. Flavor is banana. Some light spices. Nicely balanced.

Dégustée en fût sur place. De couleur jaune foncée et voilée.
Nez de levures fruitées (bananes, agrumes, surtout citron), moyen dépices (clou de girofle, notes de coriandre et de poivre), léger-moyen de blé avec des petites traces de biscuits et de gomme balloune.
Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen-fort et une texture aux notes crémeuses.
Goût de levures fruitées (bananes, léger dagrumes) et épicées (clou de girofle, traces de coriandre) avec des traces de gomme balloune lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un moyen goût de blé asséchant avec des petites notes de céréales, de biscuits et de pain puis en finale lon retrouve une légère amertume de levures aux notes épicées (traces de poivre). Post-goût moyen et un peun sec, léger-moyen amer de levures fruitées (pelures de bananes, léger zest dagrumes) et de blé.
(automne 2006)
Refreshing, of course well-brewed DDC beer.  The lemony, slightly spiced, slighty bitter taste is all well-balanced.  A very good beer
Sunday in the pub. Hazy dark yellow. Thick white head. Strong banana and chalk aroma. Thick body. Lemon, chalk and banana flavour. Peppery aftertaste.
A very hazy golden yellow weizen with a thin creamy white head. A lemony weizen with cloves and maple. Medium bodied. Strong hopping for the style. On tap at DDC, March  2007.
Robe blonde voilée surmontée dune mousse blanche mince. Arômes de bananes et de citron. Saveurs de bananes, de citron, de levures et de fruits.

[Pint @ the brewpub] Nice wheat aroma-- kind of sweet with some spices  in there. Pours a very hazy golden color that almost seems to glow in the light. A very full-flavored hefeweizen, sweet wheat, banana and clove backed up by a strong yeast presence. Not quite as "refreshing" as the usual German Hefe, this is a bit richer in body and flavor. Extremely drinkable. This is yet another outstanding beer from DDC.
quite a nice wheat beer. cloudy and pale yellow.  fruity banana aroma.  very enjoyable.

Cloudy yellow-blonde body with a large but quickly diminishing white head.  The main hefe elements are here (banana aroma, wheaty body) but the intensity is off the chart.  This is not a light refreshing hefe.  Creamy banana paste with a full haystack packed in a pint.  To go along with the not-refreshing theme, the fruitiness (banana and some peach) does not include lemon.  This is one thick and filling hefe.  They could sell as a hefe concentrate packaged in small frozen cans with the instruction add two full cans of water to obtain refreshing hefeweizen.

Bu sur place en fut (20 oz). Jaune blanchi très brumeuse, bon collet que disparait peu et laisse une belle dentaile. Arome doux de blé frait, une peu d,agrume et de banane et dépice. Bon petit goût de banane crémeuse, un peu dherbe et dépice. Très bon!

Hazy gold honey color, with a shy white head, yeasty, wheat, banana-like, with an orange note also in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a yeasty mellow wheat flavor, with a fruity banana note, leading towards a wheaten finish.
Very hazy yellow, only slight ring around the glass.  Smell and taste is very yeasty and banana.  Noticable citrus taste as well.  A pretty decent Hefe in my book.

Aroma:fruity "banana "and wheat
Appearance:Gold trouble.
Flavor:Wheat,Fruity " banana" and Vanilla.Taste like vanilla ice cream.

Shining gold pour with a light veil. Head is white, 1-inch tall, frothy. Stronger than average aroma. If they did can bananas, I assume it would smell a bit like this. It comes out slightly lactic with cinnamon and cloves afterthoughts. Sweet banana/mango palate with an honest bitter kick. Plenty of mouthfeel, an effervescent lemon pie. Pretty good for the style I found.

Hazy golden body topped with a large frothy head. Decent malty aroma with some spicy hints. Taste is well-balanced but lacks some complexity. Finish is fairly bitter, but is too short. The beer is OK, but there are plenty of better Hefeweizen.

Pint at DDC in the company of tiggmtl.  Bright, opaque luminous gold with a large but fast-decaying head...super-banana-rum-cream concoction of a nose, perhaps too sweet with little spice but splendid anyway.  Bananas & cream on the tongue, just a bit of citric tartness late.  Fairly simple and quite sweet, but very pleasant and eminently drinkable.  Mmmm.
Draft at the brewpub.  Cloudy golden ale, funky yeasty aroma.  Thick rich taste of overripe banana.  Easy on the clove and spice notes.  Awesome.
Pours a hazy blonde color with a thin qhite head. Aroma and flavor of wheat, bananas, meringue and spices. Medium body, medium oxydation, creamy texture.
Full spice and wheat aromas, hazy white/yellow, little creamy head. Spices and wheat are pronounced and appreciated. Light bodied, smooth, a very good example.

Wheat, clean spicy aroma mixed with orange peel and ripe sweet banana. Cloudy gold wheat beer, small creamy head. This beer got creamy smooth body. Banana at front and bitter finish. Interesting concept. Such bitterness made this beer les clean and drinkable.

Strong banana and mild clove with notes of vanilla in the aroma. Cloudy, dark- straw coloured with thick white head that lasts nicely. Banana flavour dominates the wheaty base with pleasant, tart, citrus finish. Creamy texture and lively carbonation. Sampled 2003.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2014 2014-08-23. Orange body with a small white head. 3+ Aroma is sweet, mild fruity esters. Flavour is similarly quite sweet, estery. Smooth average bodied palate, low carbonation. Feels a bit muddled all around. 6/3/6/3/12 On tap at DDC Tap Takeover Event, Volo, Toronto
Old rating, pre-2003 Slightly hazy but fairly clear yellow body. Slight citrusy aroma with hints of yeast and banana. 6/3/8/3/12 On tap at the brewpub, Montreal

UPDATED: APR 19, 2004 (Draught) Medium, white head and a cloudy yellow body. Nose of bananas. Better than Hacker-Pschorr Hefe Weisse. Flavours are more complex and plentiful. Great beer for a cool autumn day...
Cloudy appearance with a somewhat thick head. Complex fruity nose. Mild flavour with a touch of sourness.

Cloudy straw color, nice sticky head, banana, cloves, lemon and wheat aroma with an unfortunate hint of sulfur which gets annoying.  Creamy, fresh tasting lemony banana, a bit of wheat acidity and a fresh bread finish.  It's quite a good beer but the sulfur aroma has got to go.
Murky gold in colour.  Aroma of bananas and wheat.  Flavour of bananas, a little sour.  Finishes a little sweet.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2011 A 10-pound banana breadSpicy yeast develops vibrant clovey phenols in the nose, before the sip reveals plenty of milky banana sweetness...Drinkability is reduced by the portly body, but this remains a  delicious Weizen experience...Unless youre in the mood for a lighter example of the style...
Pale orange coloured, cloudy. Medium bodied. Lively with obvious banana type esteryness. Sweetish. A good thirst quencher.
